monq.jfa.actions

Class Stop

  • java.lang.Object
    • monq.jfa.AbstractFaAction
      • monq.jfa.actions.Stop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FaAction

    public class Stop
extends AbstractFaAction

    implements an FaAction which resets the input of the calling DfaRun to the empty string by calling DfaRun.setIn(null). If the DfaRun's Dfa has not defined an action to invoke at EOF, input processing will stop immediatly after returning from this action.

    This action leaves the matching text untouched. To do something with it, consider using a Run action.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.3 $, $Date: 2005-11-03 08:50:25 $
    Author:
    © 2005 Harald Kirsch
    See Also:

    • Field Detail

      • STOP

        public static final FaAction STOP

        a predefined FaAction with priority 0 which sets the input of the calling DfaRun to the empty string. Only if priority 0 is not what you want, create a new Stop object.

    • Constructor Detail

        public Stop(int priority)

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public void invoke(java.lang.StringBuilder out,
                   int start,
                   DfaRun runner)
        Description copied from interface: FaAction

        is called by methods of DfaRun in case of a match. Parameter yytext contains the matching text from position start onwards. The callback may change the whole of yytext, but the under most circumstances, only the matching text should be changed. Parameter runner is the DfaRun object which called this function. Of interest are its fields DfaRun.clientData and DfaRun.collect.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
